data.text: @AZDHS I have been following your daily updates since Mar 22, 20. I have been sharing 7 day averages on # of tests, case confirmed and # of deaths. These weekly numbers are not enough information.

@AZDHS I need explanations on your most recent update (Mar 2). On Feb 26, 18277270 tests were reported, and now the same number is reported on Mar 2. On Feb 26, the reported death was 27946, but the Mar 2 report says death was 27708.
@Crazed3Cat @AZDHS Its the lag that drives me the most crazy
@willhumble_az @AZDHS The claim that this is how they handle other diseases is BS. Tells me that they handle the others incorrectly too.

@heidithewiz @AZDHS Yes. Divide by 7. That is your avg daily case number. And it's from Feb 19 to Feb 26. We will get Feb 26 to march 4 in a week, on March 9. They are delaying reporting five days and then giving a week at a time. So...almost two weeks behind. We are/ we're at 1200 day avg
@TheEdgePHX @AZDHS Purposeful obfuscation. We need to sue

@AZDHS Your assistant director could not explain how to make toast. Her article is a failure as is your new reporting. Where is the weekly number of cases???? What is the daily average of cases??? It is not there. We have a right to know and you are not fulfilling your legal duties

@AZDHS Jessica - author - why are there no numbers for a weekly/ daily average? Your article absolutely sucks. Explain this to the peopyof Arizona! Your article is a failure. What is the daily avg number of cases?????? What are you hiding?????????? Time to get lawsuit going
@Occitania32 @AZDHS This is beyond outrageous. We all need to get together and protest then sue
